title: Shooting in Times Square Leaves Two Women and a Child Injured
sub_head: Saturday afternoon shooting in New York City adds to concerns about rising crime
body:
NEW YORK—A 4-year-old girl in a stroller and two women were shot Saturday afternoon in Times Square, New York Police Department officials said, in an incident whose location and timing add to rising concern about gun violence and crime in the city.
At 4:55 p.m., a person or people opened fire at the intersection of West 44th St. and Seventh Avenue, striking the women and child, officials said. Officers nearby responded to the shooting, the officials said, but the perpetrator or perpetrators departed without being apprehended.
The women and child were transported to Bellevue Hospital Center in Manhattan with non-life-threatening injuries, officials said. The officials said the victims were unrelated to each other. The victims were in stable condition, according to the officials.
One woman was struck in the foot and the other in the thigh, the officials said. The child was struck in the thigh as well, according to the officials. The officials didn’t identify the victims.
The officials said a preliminary investigation indicated that four men had a dispute on Broadway near 44th Street, and at least one of the men opened fire. The victims didn’t appear to be the intended targets of the shooter or shooters, the officials said.
